## ProgressBuilderOptions.width property

Width of the progress bar in characters (default: 40).

**Signature:**

```typescript
width?: number;
```

## Remarks

If `showPercentage` is enabled, the percentage text width is subtracted from this total width.

When set to 0, the progress bar itself is not displayed, but the percentage text (if enabled via `showPercentage`<!-- -->) will still be shown. This is rarely useful - prefer setting a positive width to display the actual bar.
